Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

No

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive normally
Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible

Question: What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The centre of the road
No passing
Fire hydrant

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

False

Question: What must you do when you see 2 red lights flashing outside a fire station?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and drive on carefully if the way is clear

Stop until the lights stop flashing

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: Who can require you to undergo a breath screening test?

Answers.Answer: An ambulance officer
A doctor
A member of the public
A police officer

Question: As the holder of any class of driver licence you must carry your licence with you at all times when driving.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: To help you from being blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Look to the left-hand side of the road
Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam

Question: A broken yellow line painted close to the edge of the road means you may stop or park your vehicle there at any time.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Warn the rider by sounding the horn on your vehicle
Slow down and give them as much room as you can
Speed up
Warn the rider by turning your vehicle headlights on

90km/h
80km/h

pull away from the side with the blowout
sway from side to side
increase speed

Use the centre line as a guide
Turn your vehicle park lights on

Question: What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: You are driving downhill on a steep, narrow road and a vehicle is coming up the hill. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Pull over to the left and give way to the vehicle coming up the hill
Flash the headlights of your vehicle at the vehicle coming up the hill
Sound the horn of your vehicle to get the vehicle coming up the hill out of the way
Do nothing, the vehicle coming up the hill should give way to you

Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
Do not drive faster than 50km/h
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

No

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up within 2 hours

Sweep it up within 24 hours
Tell a police officer

Question: At night, you MUST always dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: driving around town
driving on a motorway
following other vehicles
driving in the country

Question: When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles

adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you
